CatDescriptText: Sumner W. Carter, superintendent, Hertz U-Drive Company was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 26, 1960, pg. 29 with question: "Do you think a Negro will be named to fill the police inspectorship vacancy created by the resignation of Inspector Albert Jones?" Answer reads: "Considering all the factors, a Negro should receive the appointment.  And the trend is to give us more job opportunities...I think that a Negro police inspector would be just as good as any other person appointed."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Sumner W. Carter wearing fedora, eyeglasses, and two toned necktie, standing on sidewalk in front of street with automobiles and buildings
